qas.question: Who became president of the Congo in 1963?
What was a term that could describe the political philosophy of the Congo under Massamba-Debat?
Soldiers from which country were brought to the Congo?
When did Massamba-Debat lose power in the Congo?
What was the country's ideology before Massamba-Débat's term in office?
When did the Soviet Union establish relations with North Korea?
Who was elected president for a 10 year term?
How many Chinese troops were invited into the Congo?
When was there a coup led by paratroopers loyal to Massamba-Débat?

context: Under the 1963 constitution, <a0_0><b6_0>Massamba-Débat<b6_0/><a0_0/> was elected President for a five-year term. During Massamba-Débat's term in office the regime adopted "<a1_0><b4_0>scientific socialism<b4_0/><a1_0/>" as the country's constitutional ideology. In <b5_0>1965<b5_0/>, Congo established relations with the Soviet Union, the People's Republic of China, North Korea and North Vietnam. Massamba-Débat's regime also invited <b7_0>several hundred<b7_0/> <a2_0>Cuban<a2_0/> army troops into the country to train his party's militia units and these troops helped his government survive a coup in <b8_0>1966<b8_0/> led by paratroopers loyal to future President Marien Ngouabi. Nevertheless, Massamba-Débat was unable to reconcile various institutional, tribal and ideological factions within the country and his regime ended abruptly with a bloodless coup d'état in <a3_0>September 1968<a3_0/>.
